description: Explores the historical development of emergency management as a distinct discipline in the United States and abroad, including theories, terminology and international coordination.

sections.instructor: Mitch Saruwatari,Michael Chen,Jenny Lee,Christopher Montante,Nicolas Perez

description: Examines policies, regulations, politics and budgets that impact emergency management domestically and internationally in the government, non-profit and private sectors.

sections.instructor: Meghan McPherson,Michael Chen,Jenny Lee,Christopher Montante,Nicolas Perez

course_name: Social and Cultural Competency in Emergency Management
description: Explores how emergency management practices and community interactions can help address social, economic and cultural inequities while building increased resilience.

sections.instructor: Susan Fitzgerald,Michael Chen,Jenny Lee,Christopher Montante,Nicolas Perez

description: Examines the administrative functions of an emergency manager, including project management, policy implementation, acquisition of funding and managing diverse teams.

sections.instructor: Lydia Watts,Michael Chen,Jenny Lee,Christopher Montante,Nicolas Perez

description: Explores how to manage and assess information to limit risk and make ethical, critical decisions under both steady-state and crisis situations.

sections.instructor: Monique Lewis,Michael Chen,Jenny Lee,Christopher Montante,Nicolas Perez

description: Examines the necessary components of deliberate and crisis action plans that are used to prepare for, respond to, and recover from disasters.

sections.instructor: David Kang,Michael Chen,Jenny Lee,Christopher Montante,Nicolas Perez

description: Creating inclusive and credible messages of risk across the disaster life cycle through a variety of methods.

sections.instructor: Kevin Mcgowan,Michael Chen,Jenny Lee,Christopher Montante,Nicolas Perez

course_name: Driving Successful Outcomes in Emergency Management
description: Explores how effective emergency management leaders develop trust, avoid ethical pitfalls, strengthen partnerships and integrate equity throughout the disaster life cycle.

sections.instructor: Helen Chavez,Michael Chen,Jenny Lee,Christopher Montante,Nicolas Perez

course_name: Equity and Resilience in Emergency Management
description: Examines equity and resilience in emergency management as they pertain to areas such as planning, mitigation, disaster logistics and supply chains.

sections.instructor: Jill Ramaker,Michael Chen,Jenny Lee,Christopher Montante,Nicolas Perez

description: Demonstrate knowledge and skills developed throughout the emergency management program in an integrated way.

sections.instructor: Tiffany Danko,Michael Chen,Jenny Lee,Christopher Montante,Nicolas Perez
